headline: Caterpillar lifts revenue & CapEx targets, DraftKings downgraded
summary: Yahoo Finance anchor Josh Lipton tracks Tuesday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Caterpillar (CAT) is lifting its targets for revenue, profit margins, and capital expenditures. Yum! Brands (YUM) reported earnings that beat estimates. DraftKings (DKNG) and Flutter Entertainment (FLUT) were downgraded by Bank of America. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

content.title: Caterpillar lifts revenue & CapEx targets, DraftKings downgraded

Yahoo Finance anchor Josh Lipton tracks Tuesday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute.

Caterpillar (CAT) is lifting its targets for revenue, profit margins, and capital expenditures.

Yum! Brands (YUM) reported earnings that beat estimates.

DraftKings (DKNG) and Flutter Entertainment (FLUT) were downgraded by Bank of America.

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Amazon's transatlantic cable, Yum Brands explores Pizza Hut sale
summary: Yahoo Finance's John Hyland recaps Tuesday's headlines as part of the latest Market Minute. Investor Michael Burry disclosed puts against Palantir (PLTR) and Nvidia (NVDA). Yum Brands (YUM) is considering a sale of its Pizza Hut business. Amazon (AMZN) is working on a transatlantic cable to create an alternative pathway for data. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: ​Papa John’s Drops After Report Says Deal Is Shelved
summary: ​Papa John’s International’s shares tumbled about 10% after a report that a private-equity firm backed off a potential deal to acquire the pizza brand.  Apollo Global Management recently had bid to take Papa John’s private but withdrew that offer about a week ago, Reuters reported Wednesday.  Papa John’s is due to report quarterly results Thursday.

content.title: ​Papa John’s Drops After Report Says Deal Is Shelved
content.summary: ​Papa John’s International’s shares tumbled about 10% after a report that a private-equity firm backed off a potential deal to acquire the pizza brand.  Apollo Global Management recently had bid to take Papa John’s private but withdrew that offer about a week ago, Reuters reported Wednesday.  Papa John’s is due to report quarterly results Thursday.

headline: Papa John’s Sinks Most Since 2020 on Report Apollo Pulled Bid
summary: Apollo Global withdrew its offer to take pizza chain Papa John’s private at $64 a share about a week ago, Reuters reported, citing people familiar with the deal.  Papa John’s, which is scheduled to report third-quarter earnings on Thursday, didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment.  Analysts polled by Bloomberg expect adjusted earnings to fall 5.2% from a year earlier.

content.title: Papa John’s Sinks Most Since 2020 on Report Apollo Pulled Bid
content.summary: Apollo Global withdrew its offer to take pizza chain Papa John’s private at $64 a share about a week ago, Reuters reported, citing people familiar with the deal.  Papa John’s, which is scheduled to report third-quarter earnings on Thursday, didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment.  Analysts polled by Bloomberg expect adjusted earnings to fall 5.2% from a year earlier.

headline: Yum Brands explores options for Pizza Hut after sales slump
summary:
STORY: Yum Brands says it’s exploring options for its struggling Pizza Hut chain, even as strong demand at its other brands helped drive upbeat quarterly results.

Pizza Hut’s sales have fallen for seven straight quarters, trailing Yum Brands' other prominent restaurant chains, Taco Bell and KFC.

The company’s new CEO, Chris Turner, said Pizza Hut’s “full value” may be better realized outside of Yum Brands.

Several quarters of price hikes at restaurants, sticky inflation and economic uncertainty have forced consumers to become more wary about dining out.

However, pizzas are still viewed as a budget-friendly option.

Competitor Domino’s has seen stronger demand, helped by new menu items and delivery deals with DoorDash and UberEats.

Pizza Hut has tried its own value offers, but former CEO David Gibbs admitted in August that they weren’t enough to stand out in a crowded market.

The restaurant still operates nearly 20,000 restaurants globally, contributing about 11% of Yum’s profits, compared to 36% from Taco Bell’s U.S. business.

Analysts say selling or spinning off Pizza Hut could leave Yum anchored to its stronger Taco Bell and KFC brands.

The company says there’s no set timeline for Pizza Hut’s strategic review.

Shares of Yum Brands rose more than 6% in Tuesday afternoon trading.

content.title: Yum Brands explores options for Pizza Hut after sales slump
content.summary:
STORY: Yum Brands says it’s exploring options for its struggling Pizza Hut chain, even as strong demand at its other brands helped drive upbeat quarterly results.

Pizza Hut’s sales have fallen for seven straight quarters, trailing Yum Brands' other prominent restaurant chains, Taco Bell and KFC.

The company’s new CEO, Chris Turner, said Pizza Hut’s “full value” may be better realized outside of Yum Brands.

Several quarters of price hikes at restaurants, sticky inflation and economic uncertainty have forced consumers to become more wary about dining out.

However, pizzas are still viewed as a budget-friendly option.

Competitor Domino’s has seen stronger demand, helped by new menu items and delivery deals with DoorDash and UberEats.

Pizza Hut has tried its own value offers, but former CEO David Gibbs admitted in August that they weren’t enough to stand out in a crowded market.

The restaurant still operates nearly 20,000 restaurants globally, contributing about 11% of Yum’s profits, compared to 36% from Taco Bell’s U.S. business.

Analysts say selling or spinning off Pizza Hut could leave Yum anchored to its stronger Taco Bell and KFC brands.

The company says there’s no set timeline for Pizza Hut’s strategic review.

Shares of Yum Brands rose more than 6% in Tuesday afternoon trading.

headline: Pizza Hut's parent company says it's considering selling the chain
summary: Pizza Hut could soon be up for sale.  Yum Brands, Pizza Hut’s parent company, said Tuesday it’s conducting a formal review of options for the brand, which has struggled to compete in a crowded pizza market.  Yum CEO Chris Turner said Pizza Hut has many strengths, including a global footprint and strong growth in many markets.

content.title: Pizza Hut's parent company says it's considering selling the chain
content.summary: Pizza Hut could soon be up for sale.  Yum Brands, Pizza Hut’s parent company, said Tuesday it’s conducting a formal review of options for the brand, which has struggled to compete in a crowded pizza market.  Yum CEO Chris Turner said Pizza Hut has many strengths, including a global footprint and strong growth in many markets.

headline: Yum! Brands Considers Offloading Pizza Hut
summary: Just weeks into his new role, Yum! Brands CEO Chris Turner is weighing a sale of Pizza Hut after years of stagnation. The chain's sales are down 20% from a decade ago, even as KFC and Taco Bell continue to grow. Shelly Banjo, Bloomberg's managing editor for global business joined Bloomberg Open to talk about the chain's struggles.

content.title: Yum! Brands Considers Offloading Pizza Hut
content.description: Just weeks into his new role, Yum! Brands CEO Chris Turner is weighing a sale of Pizza Hut after years of stagnation. Shelly Banjo, Bloomberg's managing editor for global business joined Bloomberg Open to talk about the chain's struggles.

headline: Yum! Brands (NYSE:YUM) Reports Sales Below Analyst Estimates In Q3 Earnings
summary: Fast-food company Yum! Brands (NYSE:YUM) fell short of the markets revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, but sales rose 8.4% year on year to $1.98 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.58 per share was 6.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Yum! Brands Inc. Initiates Review of Strategic Options for Pizza Hut to Maximize Shareholder Value and Help It Reach Its Full Potential
summary: LOUISVILLE, Ky., November 04, 2025--Yum! Brands, Inc. (NYSE: YUM) today announced the initiation of a formal review of strategic options for the Pizza Hut brand. The intent is for Pizza Hut to reach its full potential for the benefit of its franchisees, consumers, and employees and to maximize value for Yum! shareholders. The review will explore a range of strategic options while Pizza Hut continues to focus on near-term business imperatives.

content.title: Yum! Brands Inc. Initiates Review of Strategic Options for Pizza Hut to Maximize Shareholder Value and Help It Reach Its Full Potential
content.summary: LOUISVILLE, Ky., November 04, 2025--Yum! Brands, Inc. (NYSE: YUM) today announced the initiation of a formal review of strategic options for the Pizza Hut brand. The intent is for Pizza Hut to reach its full potential for the benefit of its franchisees, consumers, and employees and to maximize value for Yum! shareholders. The review will explore a range of strategic options while Pizza Hut continues to focus on near-term business imperatives.
